{"step_by_step_thinking": "Retinol binding protein 4 (RBP4) is mentioned in several documents as an adipokine. Adipokines are biologically active factors secreted by adipose tissue. Document [0] describes RBP4 as an adipokine that contributes to insulin resistance and diabetes. Document [1] also refers to RBP4 as an adipokine, synthesized in the liver and adipose tissue. Therefore, it is clear that RBP4 is an adipokine.", "answer_choice": "A"}
